intro: Smilax pumila, commonly known as the creeping smilax, is a perennial vine native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread aggressively in moist, shaded environments. Smilax pumila is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of the understory.
